title: What Does “Fein” Mean? The Origin and Meaning of This Viral Slang Term

steps.title: Fein is a slang term for someone with an intense substance addiction.
steps.content: Fein is a slang term for someone with an intense substance addiction. Fein is a noun used to describe a person who is in the later stages of their addiction. A fein will go to the extreme to get their hands on their substance of choice. For example, if someone is constantly asking you if they can hit your vape, they are a fein. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fein is an AAVE term popularized by Travis Scott and Playboi Carti.
steps.content: Fein is an AAVE term popularized by Travis Scott and Playboi Carti. The word fein is an AAVE term for fiend that has been used for decades. In July 2023, rappers Travis Scott and Playboi Carti popularized the term when they dropped the song “FE!N” on Scott’s album, Utopia . The track is the biggest song from the album and has gone 3x Platinum. [2] X Research source The earliest known online usage of the word fein was in 2005. During concerts on the Circus Maximus tour, Scott became known for performing the track multiple times in a row. During a show in Brooklyn, New York, he performed the song 10 times in a row. [3] X Research source On July 12, 2024, TikTok user @jimmy02_ posted a video of himself at a concert singing “FE!N” that went viral. This started a trend where people sang the chorus of the song with a tone similar to that of Elvis Presley impersonators.

steps.title: Online, people use fein to refer to the Travis Scott song.
steps.content: Online, people use fein to refer to the Travis Scott song. People use the word fein in videos of Scott performing the song and fan edits of the rapper. There is also a TikTok trend where a person says “I hope they play Fein” at some sort of event. Another person dismisses their statement by saying “But we’re at [insert event here] .” The scene then cuts to Fein being sung at the event. On October 2, 2024, @2b.hlwweiz posted a video where she said “I hope they play Fein!” Her friend responded by saying, “Bro, we are in math class,” before cutting to their math teacher, singing, “Fein! Fein! Fein! Fein!”

steps.title: FEIN is also an acronym for Federal Employer Identification Number.
steps.content: FEIN is also an acronym for Federal Employer Identification Number. A Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN) is a unique nine-digit number given to businesses operating in the United States by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). A FEIN is like a Social Security number for your business and is used to identify a business when reporting taxes. [4] X Research source

steps.title: In Ireland, fein refers to supporters of Irish nationalism.
steps.content: In Ireland, fein refers to supporters of Irish nationalism. It derives from Sinn Fein, which is an Irish political organization that advocates for Ireland’s complete separation from Great Britain and a return of Northern Ireland to the Irish people. [5] X Research source
